sanskrit_verse:
वेतनस्यैव चादानं संविदश्च व्यतिक्रमः ।
क्रयविक्रयानुशयो विवादः स्वामिपालयोः ॥ ८.५॥
transliteration: vetanasyaiva cādānaṃ saṃvidaśca vyatikramaḥ | kravikrayānuśayo vivādaḥ svāmipālayoḥ || 8.5||
sph_interpretive_translation: Acceptance of wages without fulfillment of contractual duty and breach of agreement create liability between employer and employee; disputes arising from purchase and sale transactions follow the same principle.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority arises from mutual consent and capacity to fulfill obligation
Causation is established through unmet contractual duty
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by volitional engagement in transaction
Restoration logic requires completion of original contractual intent
Consciousness alignment demands integrity in exchange and service
executable_legal_axioms: IF a party accepts compensation AND fails to execute agreed duties, THEN that party incurs restorative liability until completion occurs
IF a contract is breached due to willful omission, THEN the breaching party must assume corrective action within 7 days
IF transactional dispute arises, THEN both parties shall undergo capacity verification before proceeding to resolution chamber
IF employment relation exists AND wage is taken, THEN full accountability for role-defined performance is binding
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this axiom establishes threshold responsibility based on voluntary acceptance of benefit with implicit duty. Authority lies in conscious agreement, not coercion. Judgment must prioritize restoration of functional equilibrium over punitive measures.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa is established through documented agreement and wage receipt. Anupūrvaśaḥ manifests as sequential failure post-compensation. Proportional responsibility aligns with scope of unfulfilled duty. Non-punitive reality rule ensures correction flows from individual's own causal chain.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate Completion Process: Require execution of pending obligations within defined timeframe
Assumption Protocol: Breaching party publicly reaffirms commitment to original contract
Capacity Restoration: Provide skill or resource support needed to complete obligation
Integrity Reintegration: Conduct guided reflection session to realign consciousness with dharma of exchange
final_declaration: This law proceeds solely from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam. Dharma is restored through conscious rectification. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness stands as the ultimate adjudicator.
